      • parseUrltoModuleInstanceAction

        public static java.lang.String[] parseUrltoModuleInstanceAction(java.lang.String mainPath)
        Parse url to module name , instance name and action without .do for example if mainPath contain "/news/political/showNewsDetails.do", return String[0] = news String[1] = political String[2] = showNewsDetails
        Parameters:
        mainPath -
        Returns:

      • parseUrltoModuleInstanceAction

        public static java.lang.String[] parseUrltoModuleInstanceAction(java.lang.String mainPath,
                                                                boolean instanceIsNotNull)
        Parse url to module name , instance name and action. For example, if mainPath is "/news/political/showNewsDetails", then: String[0] = news String[1] = political String[2] = showNewsDetails String[3] = /news/political/showNewsDetails If instance can not be determined (when mainPath is "/news/showNewsDetails"), then depending on instanceIsNotNull parameter, it is left to null or filled from configuration, using module's default instance
        Parameters:
        mainPath - String
        instanceIsNotNull - boolean if this is null and mainPath does not contain instance name, null will be returned. If not null, default instance is used
        Returns:
        String[]

      • fastSplit

        public static java.lang.String[] fastSplit(java.lang.String szInit,
                                           char splitChar)
        String class's split() method uses regular expression, hence is quite slow. Even a short string takes about 16 milliseconds. fastSplit() is a fast alternative which takes less than 1 millisecond.
        Parameters:
        szInit - string to split
        splitChar - char to split on
        Returns:
        string array

      • fastReplaceAll

        public static java.lang.String fastReplaceAll(java.lang.String szInit,
                                              char cFrom,
                                              char cTo)
        String class's replaceAll() method uses regular expression, hence is quite slow. fastReplaceAll() is a fast alternative which takes less than 1 millisecond. Used in simple, time-critical places.

        If you want to pass empty char (replace with removal) you need to pass '\0' or 0, because Java will not allow you to pass argument like '' for char type.

        Parameters:
        szInit - string to modify
        cFrom - character to be replaced.
        cTo - character to replace with.
        Returns:
        new String

      • fastContains

        public static boolean fastContains(java.lang.String source,
                                   java.lang.String other,
                                   boolean ignoreCase)
        tests if one string contains the other
        Parameters:
        source - the source string in which the other string is to be found
        other - the other string, which should be found in source
        ignoreCase - true if case sensitivity should be considered, false otherwise
        Returns:
        true if in source string at least one occurance of other string was found, false otherwise

      • getNoneSSOPath

      • fillPattern

        public static java.lang.String fillPattern(java.lang.String pattern,
                                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,? extends java.lang.Object> parameters)
        Analyzes passed pattern, if there is a fragment like "{some-key}", searches in the parameters map, gets its value and replaces this fragment by this value. If key was not found in the map, leaves the fragment as it is
        Parameters:
        pattern - String, containing parameters. For example, "Hello, my name is {name}, I'm {age}, what's your name?"
        parameters - Map of parameters. For the pattern above: name - Mikheil, age - 26 It's my real age for this moment. Mikheil
        Returns:
        String, assembled by the replacement procedure

      • fillPattern

        public static java.lang.String fillPattern(java.lang.String pattern,
                                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,? extends java.lang.Object> parameters,
                                           boolean useParamNames)
        Analyzes passed pattern, if there is a fragment like "{some-key}", searches in the parameters map, gets its value and replaces this fragment by this value. If key was not found in the map, leaves the fragment as it is
        Parameters:
        pattern - String, containing parameters. For example, "Hello, my name is {name}, I'm {age}, what's your name?"
        parameters - Map of parameters. For the pattern above: name - Mikheil, age - 26 It's my real age for this moment. Mikheil
        useParamNames - when true, if pattern part is unmatched, put parameter name there. When false - skip
        Returns:
        String, assembled by the replacement procedure

      • removeJSessionId

        public static java.lang.String removeJSessionId(java.lang.String calcUrl)
        Returns new string representing url with removed "jsessionid" parameter
        Parameters:
        calcUrl - Source url
        Returns:
        processed url

        public static java.lang.String dehtmlize(java.lang.String src,
                                         boolean newLines)
        Replaces html special characters by appropriate codes
        Parameters:
        src - String
        newLines - boolean if true, replace newline characters with br tags
        Returns:
        String

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        public static java.lang.String cleanWordTags(java.lang.String src)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
